qas.question: Who runs Tucson's main power plant?
What highway is Tucson's main power plant near?
What does Tucson's main power plant use for fuel?
When did Tucson's main power plant begin operation?
How many days of sunshine does Tucson get each year?

context: Tucson's primary electrical power source is a <a2_0>coal and natural gas<a2_0/> power-plant managed by <a0_0>Tucson Electric Power<a0_0/> that is situated within the city limits on the south-western boundary of Davis-Monthan Air-force base adjacent to <a1_0>Interstate-10<a1_0/>. The air pollution generated has raised some concerns as the Sundt operating station has been online since <a3_0>1962<a3_0/> as is exempt from many pollution standards and controls due to its age. Solar has been gaining ground in Tucson with its ideal <a4_0>over 300<a4_0/> days of sunshine climate. Federal, state, and even local utility credits and incentives have also enticed residents to equip homes with solar systems. Davis-Monthan AFB has a 3.3 Megawatt (MW) ground-mounted solar photovoltaic (PV) array and a 2.7 MW rooftop-mounted PV array, both of which are located in the Base Housing area. The base will soon have the largest solar-generating capacity in the United States Department of Defense after awarding a contract on September 10, 2010, to SunEdison to construct a 14.5 MW PV field on the northwestern side of the base.
